content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is how you can do it:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T<:Real}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, x::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, string(x.value), " ", x.unit)
end
```
This `show` function takes an I/O stream and a FloatWithUnits instance as input and outputs the value and unit separated by a space. The string conversion is done using the `string` function so that if the value of the FloatWithUnits is not a simple number (like Ï€), it will still print out nicely.
